p: The S protein on the surface of the virus is a key factor involved in infection. It is a trimeric class I TM glycoprotein responsible for viral entry, and it is present in all kinds of HCoVs, as well as in other viruses such as HIV (HIV glycoprotein 160, Env), influenza virus (influenza hemagglutinin, HA), paramyxovirus (paramyxovirus F), and Ebola (Ebola virus glycoprotein) [ 30]. Similar to other coronaviruses, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 mediates receptor recognition, cell attachment, and fusion during viral infection [ 16, 20, 21, 31â€“ 33].
